name: Cloud
description: I wandered lonely as a cloud, that floats on high o'er vales and hills - William Wordsworth
title: View of Monticelli, near Tivoli
author: Simon-Joseph-Alexandre-Clément Denis

name: Wind
description: Wind is the flow of gas. Whooosh!
title: Wanderer above the sea of fog
author: Caspar David Friedrich

name: Sky
description: The stars they were among my dreams; In sleep did I behold the skies - William Wordsworth
title: The Voyage of Life
author: Thomas Cole

name: Sea
description: Inspiring both brilliant and novice poets alike.
title: A Packet Boat Under Sail in a Breeze off the South Foreland
author: Thomas Lunyr

name: Flower
description: Sweet smelling (well, most of them anyway).
title: Still-Life
author: Paul Theodor van Brussel

name: Ginger Bread
description: This is chocolate! gasped Hansel as he broke a lump of plaster from the wall. And this is icing!exclaimed Gretel, putting another piece of wall in her mouth. -Brothers Grimm
author: Luis Meléndez

name: Witch
description: Flying to Blockula and building houses of gingerbread.
title: The Bewitched Man
author: Francisco de Goya y Lucientes

name: Mermaid
description: Half woman, half fish.
title: A Mermaid
author: John William Waterhouse

name: Mirror
description: Mirror, mirror, here I stand. Who is the fairest in the land? -Brothers Grimm
title: Portrait of Catherine II before a Mirror
author: Vigilius Eriksen

name: Lost Shoe
description: Rook di goo, rook di goo! No blood's in the shoe. The shoe's not too tight,This bride is right!-Brothers Grimm
title: Cinderella
author: Charles Landseer

name: Musketeer
description: All for one and one for all, united we stand divided we fall- Alexandre Dumas
title: Musketeer
author: Jean-Louis-Ernest Meissonier

name: French Revolution
description: Lasted from year 1789 to year 1799. The revolution overthrow the absolute monarchy in France.
title: Liberty Leading the People
author: Eugène Delacroix

name: Letters
description: Tells of events between friends, business and family.
title: Lady Reading the Letters of Heloise and Abélard
author: Bernard D’Agesci

name: Nationalism
description: Being attached to one’s nation. Many countries during this period was associated with nationalism.
title: The Third of May, 1808: The Execution of the Defenders of Madrid
author: Francisco de Goya y Lucientes

name: Middle ages
description: Was very fashionable during the Romanticism period.
title: Edward III Crossing the Somme
author: Benjamin West

name: Faint
description: Loss of consciousness and muscle strength.
title: Roger Freeing Angelica
author: Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres

name: Hunting
description: Hunting description
title: Hunting Scene
author: Horace Vernet

name: The Nightmare
description: So on his Nightmare through the evening fog. Flits the squab Fiend o'er fen, and lake, and bog; Seeks some love-wilder'd maid with sleep oppress'd, Alights, and grinning sits upon her breast. - Erasmus Darwin
title: The Nightmare
author: Johann Heinrich Füssli

name: Night
description: Who knows what lurks in the shadows..
title: Knight before the Charcoal Burner's Hut
author: Carl Philipp Fohr

name: The Hunchback
description: A deformed man.
title: Quasimodo sauvant la Esmeralda des mains de ses bourreaux, illustrant un épisode de Notre-Dame de Paris de Victor Hugo.
author: Mlle Henry

name: Scientist
description: A person who craves for more knowledge. But is there a limit to what Man should know ?
title: Self-Portrait with Doctor Arrieta
author: Francisco de Goya y Lucientes

name: Fallen Angel
description: I ought to be thy Adam, but I am rather the fallen angel…- Mary Shelley
title: The Angel Standing in the Sun
author: Joseph Mallord William Turner

name: Death
description: I'm Death, and I make sure that everyone is equal. -Brothers Grimm
title: Saturn Devouring One of his Children
author: Francisco de Goya y Lucientes

name: Grim
description: Hopeless. Ghastly. Gloomy. What a cheerful word...
title: The Headless Horseman Pursuing Ichabod Crane
author: John Quidor

name: Raven
description: Quoth the Raven, Nevermore -Edgar Allan Poe
title: The Tree of Crows
author: Caspar David Friedrich

name: Cat
description: Upon its head, with red extended mouth and solitary eye of fire, sat the hideous beast whose craft had seduced me into murder - Edgar Allan Poe
title: Una and the Lion
author: Briton Rivière

name: Train
description: description
title: Open carriages on the Liverpool and Manchester Railway in 1830

name: Industry
description: description
title: The Crystal Palace held the Great Exhibition of 1851

name: Pure Heart
description: She cannot receive any power from me greater than she now has, which consists in her own purity and innocence of heart - H.C.Andersen
title: Ophelia
author: John William Waterhouse

name: Wolf
description: A forest dwelling creature. Rumors say it eats children
title: Dead Wolf
author: Jean-Baptiste Oudry

name: Ossian
description: The narrator from The Work of Ossian
title: Ossian’s Dream
author: Jean Auguste Dominique Ingres

name: Princess
description: There lived a king whose daughters were all beautiful, but the youngest daughter was so lovely that even the sun...was struck with wonder -Brothers Grimm
title: Portrait of Princesse Albert de Broglie
author: Jean Auguste Dominique Ingres

name: Erlking
description: Who rides, so late, through night and wind? It is the father with his child. He has the boy well in his arm. He holds him safely, he keeps him warm. - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
title: Erlking
author: Moritz von Schwind

name: Faust
description: “Faust: Who holds the devil, let him hold him well, He hardly will be caught a second time.” - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
title: Faust
author: William Henry Margetson

name: The Hay Wain
description: Sweet is the lore which nature brings; Our meddling intellect. Misshapes the beauteous forms of things; We murder to dissect. - William Wordsworth
title: The Hay Wain
author: John Constable

name: Chios massacre
description: The Turks went there. Everything is in ruin and mourning. Chio, the island of wine, is only a dark reef. Chio, shaded by the bushes. Chio, who in the waves reflected his great woods, its hillsides, its palaces, and in the evening sometimes a dancing choir of young girls. - Victor Hugo (translation)
title: The Massacre at Chios
author: Eugène Delacroix
